**The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song**

**Title:** *The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song*
**Six fascicles.** Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song.
**Source text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Writings and Memorials* section of the *Dongzhen* department.

---

### **Fascicle One of *The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song***

#### **First Memorial of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Wheat**
**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

Of late, though the rites of worship to the True Ones have been observed in due course, my heart, ever vigilant against negligence, has feared its own inadequacy. Yet upon this blessed land, a wondrous omen has suddenly manifested: the fertile fields, once more, have borne fine grain. Witnessing this harmonious concordance of divine favor, I perceive the Heavenly Will’s gracious regard. Overwhelmed by the descent of such felicity, I can but redouble my resolve to cultivate virtue.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Three Memorials of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that at the cypress altar by the dragon well, prayers for blessings were offered in due reverence; within the Hall of Felicity, the appointed day was chosen to proclaim the auspicious hour. The divination proved unanimous, and the rites were duly performed. The August Heaven, in its lofty regard, bestowed a propitious response. Though I am of humble station, I have been vouchsafed great favor. Ever mindful of this, I shall strive to repay such boundless grace.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that the divine chariot descended with felicity, halting its immortal journey within the palace precincts; the celestial chart aligned with fortune, revealing its precious counsel for ten thousand years. As the seasons turned, I renewed my earnest offerings. Heaven’s blessings, abundant and manifold, have truly manifested the depth of its protective regard. Never shall I forget my vigilance by day or night, but shall ever redouble my reverent resolve.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the August Ancestor, Heavenly Worthy, and Great Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that at the dragon well and the Hall of Felicity, preparations were made in advance; within the sacred palace and the pure temple, solemn announcements were devoutly offered. The rites were grand, with fragrant offerings and resonant music. Such abundant blessings flow from the wellspring of divine favor, and thus the auspicious signs flourish. The benevolence that bestows blessings upon all beings has been manifest in these great responses; the filial piety that seeks to emulate the past shall ever inspire my earnest devotion.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **First Memorial of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens from Heaven and Earth**
**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that my earnest devotion has moved the divine heart, and the gracious responses have truly revealed Heaven’s protective regard. Of late, the ritual texts have been reverently studied, and the solemn sacrifices diligently performed. I have received the Heavenly Mandate’s bestowed favor and been granted precious signs of blessing. Auspicious signs have converged in splendor, and wondrous omens have arrived in abundance. They herald the coming of great fortune and demonstrate the eternal firmness of the imperial foundation. Though my virtue is meager, I have been favored with such manifest blessings. I shall redouble my humble diligence to worthily receive this great bestowal.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Two Memorials of Thanksgiving for Rain**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that I have inherited this blessed foundation and now govern all within the four seas. Relying on Heaven’s protection, I seek to preserve the people’s harmony. Recently, as I performed the sacrificial rites, the rains were delayed, and I feared the crops would suffer, jeopardizing the harvest’s abundance. I hoped to witness the auspicious signs of the sun and moon, that the people’s desire for full granaries might be fulfilled. Thus, I offered secret prayers, and the response was swift and clear. The fields have now received their nourishing moisture. Heaven’s regard has answered like an echo, and my heart, ever vigilant, shall redouble its resolve.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I have inherited this vast domain and secured its peace. In gratitude for Heaven’s regard, I have never forgotten my duties, waking or sleeping. Recently, as the grand rites were completed, the rains were delayed. The abundant harvests, once filling the granaries, have suffered from the lack of moisture. I prayed for the clouds to gather and the rains to nourish the land. My secret prayers were devoutly offered, and the response was swift and clear: sweet rains have now spread across the great fields. Heaven’s protective regard has been manifest, and my reverent devotion shall grow ever more earnest.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Two Memorials of Thanksgiving for the Bestowal of Favor upon the Imperial Son**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that the vast and sheltering power of Heaven has bestowed its great protection; the flourishing of the imperial lineage has secured the eternal foundation. [Name of the imperial son], having received Heaven’s blessings, has now reached the age to begin his studies. In accordance with state rituals, he has been granted a fiefdom. Thus, I have humbly submitted to the favor of the sacred turf and further elevated his rank among the imperial guards. This great felicity adorns the imperial house, and I shall strive to repay it with earnest devotion. May his blessings ever flourish and his auspicious signs multiply.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

**Memorial of Gratitude for the Ennoblement of the Imperial Son**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. Having received the sacred edict as conveyed, I am overwhelmed by the boundless grace bestowed upon me, and my heart brims with both honor and trepidation.

The rites of enfeoffment rightfully belong to the imperial lineage, and the exalted rank of nobility is justly conferred upon those of great virtue. I, in my youth, have been deemed worthy to stand as a pillar of the realm. While still receiving the tender guidance of my parents, I have already been sheltered by Heaven’s favor; and now, with the bestowal of noble insignia, I am suddenly illuminated by the state’s enduring principles. My position is elevated among the ranks of the imperial guards, my rank held in highest esteem. Such extraordinary favor from the court and country shines resplendently upon the imperial house. How dare I not rouse myself day and night, diligently studying the *Book of Songs* and the *Book of Rites*? I shall strive to cultivate both loyalty and filial piety, that I may forever bask in the blessings of the divine.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for the Imperial Son’s Birthday**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. As the season of summer approaches and the month of the sun’s zenith arrives, the fifteenth day of the lunar cycle marks the anniversary of my birth. Heaven’s heart has bestowed its protection, and the imperial lineage has gathered its auspicious signs. May all blessings be fittingly bestowed, for the Three Powers have granted their great favor.

How dare I not redouble my diligence and reverence, striving to repay this lofty grace? May the divine gaze deign to look upon me, that my blessings may ever flourish.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for the Seven-Eared Wheat from Zhongwu Army**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. I have learned that the Zhongwu Army has reported the discovery of a single stalk of wheat bearing seven ears. This is a manifestation of the divine heart’s watchful care and a resplendent omen of prosperity. Beholding the fields, we see the nurturing of this auspicious grain. Grown upon the fertile lands of the capital’s hinterlands, it stands as a sign of the year’s abundance. Having received such great favor, I shall redouble my efforts in loyal devotion.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for the Auspicious Jade Stone from Zizhou**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. In preparation for the carving of a sacred image, I have reverently attended the imperial court. From the shores of the sea, we have gathered this jade-like stone from Yan, and along its journey, it has responded with favorable signs. Through the auspiciousness of the landscape, we have witnessed the gaze of the vast heavens. Inwardly, I am filled with humility, and I lift my gaze in gratitude. I shall redouble my sincerity to receive this great protection.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for Auspicious Omens**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. As I prepare to offer prayers at the sacred palace, seeking pure blessings, the reports of auspicious omens have become manifest, illuminating the great favor bestowed. Moreover, the prior days were marked by solemn preparation, and the rites of purification have been duly observed. The pale moon has revealed its signs, and the radiant clouds have displayed their wonders. Sweet dew has descended in abundance, nourishing the towering branches. Turning inward, I, in my humble station, have received this great response. My heart is filled with reverence for this majesty, and I shall strive to repay the boundless grace that has been so generously bestowed.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for the Winter Solstice**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. As the year draws to its close, the winter solstice has arrived. The great harvests of the fields have come to fruition, and all people under Heaven ascend to a state of benevolence and longevity. I have been favored with divine regard and have inherited this blessed foundation. All nations come to court, bearing witness to this great favor; the Nine Virtues are in harmony, and we forever rely upon this pure blessing.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial of Gratitude for the New Year**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. As the bronze sundial marks the completion of the year, the flutes herald the arrival of spring. All beings rejoice in abundance, ascending to a state of benevolence and longevity; every living creature is blessed, gathering in the fullness of fortune. I, in my humble station, have inherited this great legacy. My resolve to rise early and serve with diligence shall never waver, and I shall strive to perpetuate the blessings that have been so graciously bestowed.

Moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, I respectfully present this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**Memorial to Petition for the Bestowal of a Sacred Title (Three Memorials)**

With utmost reverence and awe, I, the imperial son [Name], prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words. In my humble and unworthy state, I have received this great protection. Though I dwell in the mortal realm, I have been graced with divine observation; in my reverence for the descent of the true, how dare I forget the firmness of Heaven’s support? Thus, I lift my gaze to the purple heavens, humbly offering a grand title. Through the descent of manifest responses, may my sincere heart ascend. Now, as I stand before the sacred image and receive the counsel of my ministers, I shall command the relevant offices to enact this noble decree. The Celestial Capital lies within sight, as if but a short distance away; with a heart laid bare, I pray that the lofty and luminous may deign to take notice.

Humbly, I present this memorial to make known my petition. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

Having inherited the realm, I have been blessed with the protection of profound peace; descending to observe the foundation of my mandate, I forever cherish the favor of your watchful grace. Thus, I reverently gaze upon the boundless cosmos, humbly offering a grand title. May my fervent devotion, like wings outstretched, answer the limitless treasure of your mandate.

Now, the central decree has been issued, solemnly proclaimed to the outer courts. As this grand ceremony unfolds, it is truly the radiant numen that deigns to look upon us. Reflecting inwardly upon my inadequacy, I am all the more filled with trembling reverence. Only by striving with utmost devotion may I hope to manifest your great bestowals.

Your subject, overwhelmed by reverence and urgency, humbly presents this memorial to make known my petition. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

The Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Venerable Great Emperor,
The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

Having inherited the great legacy of accumulated blessings, I have been entrusted with the governance of the central realm; bearing the vast auspicious signs of the Great Purple One, I have brought about supreme order. Gazing upward toward the celestial pole, I reverently offer a precious title. May I be deemed worthy of your benevolent favor, that I may fulfill the rites of trembling reverence.

Now, the solemn proclamation has been made, and abundant manifestations of fortune have descended. Looking inward upon my humble self, how dare I forget my reverent devotion?

Your subject, overwhelmed by reverence and urgency, humbly presents this memorial to make known my petition. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial to Present the Sacred Title and Auspicious Omens to the Jade Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

By the grace of your numinous power, I have received the exalted mandate and foundation. Now, as I honor the grand title, I seek to repay your watchful gaze. Reverently facing your august countenance, I personally announce this to the assembled ministers. Suddenly, wondrous responses have become manifest, and auspicious signs have been abundantly witnessed in the sacred scriptures. Reflecting upon my humble self, I have received this glorious favor. Only by maintaining vigilance day and night may I answer the fortune of Heaven.

Your subject, overwhelmed by gratitude and joy, humbly presents this memorial in thanks. With utmost reverence and gratitude, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanks for the Proclamation of the Sacred Title to the Jade Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

Having received the precious mandate, I govern the multitudes. Enduring the boundless favor of your watchful grace, I strive to enhance my reverent devotion. Thus, I gaze upward toward the boundless cosmos and lead the vast realm below. Pouring forth my sincere heart, I have reverently honored the grand title. Today, it has been solemnly proclaimed to the outer courts. All officials hasten to attend, rejoicing together in this auspicious gathering; the Nine Heavens look down in approval, increasing the abundance of this propitious era.

How dare I not remain vigilant night and day, rising early without rest? May I abundantly manifest this grand ceremony, that I may reverently serve the numinous power.

Your subject, overwhelmed by gratitude, joy, and urgency, humbly presents this memorial in thanks. With utmost reverence and gratitude, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanks for the Auspicious Omens to the Jade Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

Humbly receiving your pure bestowals, I lead the people. Reverently offering a grand title, I abundantly extol your precious favor. Now, the proclamation has been announced to the outer courts, aligning with the primal celestial signs; the splendid omens have become manifest, illuminating your great favor. Reflecting upon my unworthy virtue, I have witnessed these auspicious signs. I shall redouble my utmost devotion, forever bearing your benevolent responses.

Your subject, overwhelmed by gratitude, joy, and urgency, humbly presents this memorial in thanks. With utmost reverence and gratitude, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanks for the Bestowal of the Sacred Title to the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Venerable Great Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

Having received the accumulated auspicious legacy, the great mandate has been inaugurated; bearing the virtue of your watchful observation, the grand ceremony has been fulfilled. I, your subject, reverently inherit these blessed signs and govern the people. The realm is pacified, truly relying upon your descending favor; day and night, I strive with devotion, how dare I forget to manifest my repayment?

Thus, I lead the vast realm below and gaze upward toward the Dark Capital, together offering a grand title, hoping to extol your vast protection. My trembling reverence knows no rest; your benevolent grace has suddenly become manifest in the aid of the world below. Now, the proclamation has been harmoniously announced, and the rites shall be performed. Though the celestial hearing is most lofty, it is through the assistance of the immortal source that this has been achieved. Reflecting inwardly upon my humble self, I reverently bear your guidance, only increasing my trembling reverence to reverently receive your bestowals.

Your subject, overwhelmed by gratitude, joy, and urgency, humbly presents this memorial in thanks. With utmost reverence and gratitude, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanks for the Bestowal of the Sacred Title and Auspicious Omens to the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Venerable Great Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

I reverently receive your encompassing grace and humbly inherit the mandate of peace, striving with utmost devotion to receive your great blessings. Recently, I have led the vast realm in reverently offering a grand title, aligning with the primal celestial signs, and now solemnly proclaiming it. My fervent devotion remains urgent; the auspicious responses have become fully manifest in your watchful favor. Forever cherishing your bestowals, I abundantly display your descending favor, increasing my trembling reverence to exalt the Way’s sheltering grace.

Your subject, overwhelmed by gratitude, joy, and urgency, humbly presents this memorial in thanks. With utmost reverence and gratitude, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanks for the Assent to the Bestowal of the Sacred Title to the Jade Emperor

The Heir Apparent and Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and gratitude, prostrates himself, bows twice, and humbly submits these words:

I have heard that the great mandate accumulates in abundance through the watchful gaze of the boundless cosmos; wondrous responses become manifest through the luminous inspiration of the Celestial Capital. Having received the condescending regard of your lofty and luminous presence, I am truly filled with trembling reverence in both waking and dreaming.

I, your subject, have been deemed worthy to inherit this foundation, though my qualities are unworthy. Abundantly receiving the precious mandate, I have been granted the primal talisman. Through this, the Four Seas are at peace, relying upon the descending favor of the Nine Yang. Though my towering virtue is unworthy to repay this grace, my trembling heart strives with devotion without cease.

Thus, considering the unity of all within the realm, I have reverently offered this august name on high. Deep within, my heart is firmly rooted in the firmament, and with utmost sincerity, I strive to exhaust all devotion. Gazing in awe toward your majestic spirit, my trembling reverence grows ever more profound.

By the mysterious communion of Heaven’s will and the harmonious accord of divine counsel, my earnest supplications have been made manifest, and your gracious assent has been revealed. Now, the great rites shall be solemnly proclaimed and observed throughout the vast expanse. Not only does this humble one receive the favor of your benevolent regard, but indeed, all within the four seas shall together bask in the shelter of your boundless grace. Day and night, I labor diligently to express my reverence and veneration.

I, your subject, am overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure. Humbly, I present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

---

A Memorial of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens

To the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Venerable Great Emperor,

I, your subject, [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words:

I reflect upon how the design of the Mysterious Chamber was early bestowed by your great favor, and how the Hall of Assembled Perfection was established through the devotion of a sincere heart. Beholding the inception of the Sacred Pavilion’s construction, we now offer the jade-scripture caskets with reverence. Its towering beams and intricate adornments store forth luminous responses and accumulate auspicious signs. Truly, it stirs the sentiments of all under heaven and further illuminates the canon of wondrous portents.

With deepest reverence, I receive your radiant grace, prostrate in accumulated devotion.

I, your subject, am overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure. Humbly, I present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

*End of Scroll One of the Imperial Compositions of the Jade Capital*
*Scroll Two of the Imperial Compositions of the Jade Capital*

**Ten Memorials on Auspicious Omens at the True Wandering Palace**

**To Heaven**
The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. Reverently receiving the imperial journey to the immortal realms, I have completed the secret palace, its construction harmoniously fulfilled, its descending gaze most luminous. Beholding the convergence of wondrous portents, truly the numinous heart is grandly revealed. Though my virtue be meager, I have been blessed with auspicious signs; guarding this foundation of felicity, I ever more diligently purify my resolve. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. Reverently unfolding the records of auspices, the numinous heart is abundantly revealed. Your benevolent protection, so perfectly harmonious with the state and household; my reverent devotion, truly unwavering day and night. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. The construction commenced in due season, and propitious omens have repeatedly manifested. The records of auspices, when examined, truly protect our state and household; reverently receiving this felicitous legacy, may it flourish for our ancestral temples. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. As the true imperial chariot parted the clouds, abundant blessings were bestowed; the lofty halls, bathed in sunlight, were renewed in grand design. The work now completed, the descending gaze has been repeatedly revealed. Felicitous omens profusely converge, ever bearing your gracious favor; reverently receiving this ancestral protection, may it ever more flourish in filial devotion. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. With the beams and eaves now erected, luminous responses are repeatedly revealed; felicitous omens profusely converge, truly bearing the fruits of your foresight. Ever more I redouble my filial devotion, to receive this mandate of destiny. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. As the divine chariot’s journey descended to the secret palace, the cloud-surpassing edifice reverently received its numinous source. The completion of its adornment came in due season, and felicitous omens repeatedly aligned. The records of auspices, when examined, truly abound in descending blessings; your merciful teachings, ever cherished, deepen my filial devotion. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

**To Empress Dowager Mingde**
The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. As the layered heavens drew near, long abiding in the imperial chambers; the lofty beams and foundations were raised, to manifest the precious favor. All laborers gathered, and auspicious omens abundantly shone forth. Your nurturing benevolence, ever mindful of your merciful teachings; my reverent resolve, ever diligent in filial devotion. Overwhelmed with gratitude and awe beyond measure, I humbly present this memorial in thanksgiving. I, your subject, with utmost sincerity and joy, bow twice, bow twice again, and humbly submit these words.

**To Empress Dowager Yide**
The Heaven-Succeeding Son of Heaven, your subject [Name], with utmost sincerity and joy, bows twice, bows twice again, and humbly submits these words. As the precious favor resplendently manifested, the divine wind drew near. Beholding the secret palace of extended truth, I have adorned its grand form. Manifest responses spread abundantly, and auspicious signs appear in full splendor. Precious feathers gather in graceful flight, revealing the perfect harmony of pure blessings. May the heart that reveres Your protective regard forever flourish in radiant favor; may the resolve of trembling devotion steadfastly uphold the foundations of felicity. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

*A Prayer for the Inner Palace Ritual of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens*

To the Three Clarities,

Your servant, having received the precious mandate and inherited the sacred talisman, beholds the grand observances now augmented and the auspicious signs made manifest. Clouds of dawn shimmer with color, and immortal birds convey celestial melody. The profound devotion of this heart expresses the regard of Your observation; the resolve of day and night exhausts its reverence in diligent service. Within the inner sanctum’s pure seclusion, the ritual altar is reverently arrayed. We humbly pray that Your protective regard and discerning majesty be abundantly bestowed. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

*A Prayer for the Ritual of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens at the Upper Clarity Palace*

To the Three Clarities,

Your servant, having reverently inherited the established foundation and received the great favor, now turns toward the Jade Palace in obeisance, whence the celestial pole descends its grace. Auspicious vapors coil in radiance, and numinous birds soar in pairs. Bearing the vast response of Your luminous regard, we look down to safeguard the sacred chart; with the earnest devotion of dawn’s vigil, we gaze upward to requite Your protective grace. Gazing toward the tranquil hall, we reverently prepare the ritual altar. We pray that the brilliance of Your discerning observation and the utmost sincerity of our reverence be fully perceived. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

*Thirteen Prayers Regarding the Fire Incident*

To the Three Clarities and the Jade Clarity Luminous Response Palace,

Your servant, though of humble station, has inherited this great treasure. Though perfect blessings abound, true governance remains unachieved. Recently, within the palace precincts, fire unexpectedly spread. Gazing upon the court, we were deeply alarmed. Though human affairs bear their causes, how dare we forget trembling reverence? May the numinous wisdom not be obscured, and in our fear and trembling, may it deign to regard us. With utmost sincerity, we humbly express our gratitude and repentance. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Jade Emperor,

Your servant, governing the central realm, is shamed by his unworthy virtue. Though Your luminous protection has been graciously bestowed, our governance has failed to strike the mean. Recently, within the princely residence, embers were left unattended, and the flames soon spread to the palace precincts. Though long since extinguished, the fire caused considerable damage. The fault lies with human error; how dare we not acknowledge our guilt? Yet we reflect in awe, striving to improve. May we humble ourselves and earnestly pray for Your gracious regard. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Honored Great Emperor,

Your servant, having received Your protection, has accumulated reverent awe. Yet reflecting on the recent alarm, we find no peace. Due to the princely residence’s failure in vigilance, the palace precincts suffered the spread of fire. Truly, human affairs have fallen short of the numinous will. The heart that acknowledges fault trembles without respite; the earnest plea for manifest gratitude humbly beseeches Your gracious regard. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Northern Culmen,

Your servant, ever mindful of his unworthy virtue, reverently inherits the great legacy. Though we strive earnestly from dawn, our governance is replete with shortcomings. Due to the princely residence’s lack of vigilance, the palace precincts suffered the spread of fire. How dare we forget to acknowledge our fault and offer repentance to the august numen? We earnestly pray that the reservoir of benevolence may fully perceive our sincere plea. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Heavenly Scriptures,

Your servant, inwardly reflecting on his humble station, has received the auspicious mandate. Though we have not forgotten reverent service, we have failed to repay the bestowed blessings. Embers spread from the princely residence, and the flames, unchecked, reached the palace precincts. Reflecting on the alarm, our trembling reverence only deepens. How dare we not acknowledge our fault and offer gratitude for the granted talisman? With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Great Ancestor Emperor,

Your servant, reverently inheriting the blessed foundation and abundantly receiving the bestowed favors, reflects on his unworthy virtue and fails to repay the origins of prosperity. As the raging flames spread from the inner defenses, they soon reduced all to ashes. Unable to contain them, we were left with only remorse. Inwardly reflecting on our humble station, we have failed in vigilance; gazing upward, we accumulate shame for our many shortcomings. We humbly offer gratitude to the ancestral temple, never forgetting our duty day or night. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Great Ancestor Emperor Taizong,

Your servant, reverently inheriting the mandate and humbly continuing the legacy, acknowledges his failures, which have given rise to this calamity. Reflecting on the embers that arose within the palace precincts, we recognize how the flames alarmed the people. Considering our lack of vigilance in human affairs, we are truly ashamed of the state’s ungoverned disorder. The heart of diligent service finds no rest from dawn; the resolve to express gratitude strives to perfect our conduct. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Hall of the Two Stars,

Reflecting on the benevolence of Heaven’s regard, we have received its protection; yet the virtue of our rule is shamed by our humble station. Fire precautions were neglected, and the palace precincts suffered the spread of flames. Truly, our failure in human affairs dares not offend the numinous will. We humbly offer manifest gratitude and dare not forget self-reflection. With reverent sincerity, we earnestly pray that Your utmost devotion be perceived. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the August Sage,

Reflecting on our humble station, we have received the precious mandate; with a heart of diligent service, we strive to respond to the great blessings. Yet speaking of the princely residence, we momentarily forgot vigilance, allowing the raging flames to spread. Witnessing the alarm, our reverent awe only deepened. How dare we forget to acknowledge our fault and offer repentance to the luminous numen? With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Various Minor Halls,

Privately reflecting on the mandate we have received, we have abundantly attained radiant favor. Yet in our humble station, we reflect and fail to repay the great blessings.

Through negligence in guarding the princely residence, disaster spread in raging flames. The inner sanctum was shaken, the central halls consumed by fire. Reflecting on the unmanifested vastness of your virtue, we accumulate this crimson heart in self-reproach. With daring humility, we offer our gratitude, earnestly hoping for your gracious regard.

To the Three Clarities of the Supreme Clarity Palace,

This humble servant’s virtue is too meager to evoke resonance. Yet the boundless benevolence of the celestial vault has deigned to turn its compassionate gaze. Before the governance of the Central Establishment could be fully realized, the omen of ascending flames arose. A moment’s lapse in vigilance over the princely residence allowed the raging flames to suddenly spread in alarming conflagration. Mindful of our inadequacy, how dare we neglect self-examination? With reverent sincerity, we strive to express our luminous gratitude.

To the Jade Emperor,

This humble servant, inheriting this great mandate, though never forgetting diligence and caution, momentarily faltered in vigilance. Within the princely residence, a lingering ember suddenly flared. Within the central halls, the fire swiftly spread. Recognizing our failure in careful watchfulness, we deeply reproach ourselves. With reverent humility, we offer our gratitude, trusting in your gracious regard of our utmost sincerity.

To the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Honored Great Emperor,

This humble servant, continuing the blessed legacy, trembles in awe of the numinous mandate. Though filled with trepidation, we have failed to repay your watchful gaze. Raging flames spread disaster, arising unexpectedly in the royal residence; the encircling corridors could not be saved, and the fire swiftly reached the central gate. Inwardly reflecting on our inadequacy, we find no peace. We humbly beseech the vast source to accept our luminous gratitude, daring to extend our sincere devotion in full.

Thus concludes the sixth scroll of *The Jade Capital Collection* composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song.

**The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song**

**Title:** *The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song*
**Six fascicles.** Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song.
**Source text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Writings and Memorials* section of the *Dongzhen* department.

---

### **Fascicle One of *The Jade Capital Collection Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song***

#### **First Memorial of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Wheat**
**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

Of late, though the rites of worship to the True Ones have been observed in due course, my heart, ever vigilant against negligence, has feared its own inadequacy. Yet upon this blessed land, a wondrous omen has suddenly manifested: the fertile fields, once more, have borne fine grain. Witnessing this harmonious concordance of divine favor, I perceive the Heavenly Will’s gracious regard. Overwhelmed by the descent of such felicity, I can but redouble my resolve to cultivate virtue.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Three Memorials of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that at the cypress altar by the dragon well, prayers for blessings were offered in due reverence; within the Hall of Felicity, the appointed day was chosen to proclaim the auspicious hour. The divination proved unanimous, and the rites were duly performed. The August Heaven, in its lofty regard, bestowed a propitious response. Though I am of humble station, I have been vouchsafed great favor. Ever mindful of this, I shall strive to repay such boundless grace.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that the divine chariot descended with felicity, halting its immortal journey within the palace precincts; the celestial chart aligned with fortune, revealing its precious counsel for ten thousand years. As the seasons turned, I renewed my earnest offerings. Heaven’s blessings, abundant and manifold, have truly manifested the depth of its protective regard. Never shall I forget my vigilance by day or night, but shall ever redouble my reverent resolve.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the August Ancestor, Heavenly Worthy, and Great Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that at the dragon well and the Hall of Felicity, preparations were made in advance; within the sacred palace and the pure temple, solemn announcements were devoutly offered. The rites were grand, with fragrant offerings and resonant music. Such abundant blessings flow from the wellspring of divine favor, and thus the auspicious signs flourish. The benevolence that bestows blessings upon all beings has been manifest in these great responses; the filial piety that seeks to emulate the past shall ever inspire my earnest devotion.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **First Memorial of Thanksgiving for Auspicious Omens from Heaven and Earth**
**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that my earnest devotion has moved the divine heart, and the gracious responses have truly revealed Heaven’s protective regard. Of late, the ritual texts have been reverently studied, and the solemn sacrifices diligently performed. I have received the Heavenly Mandate’s bestowed favor and been granted precious signs of blessing. Auspicious signs have converged in splendor, and wondrous omens have arrived in abundance. They herald the coming of great fortune and demonstrate the eternal firmness of the imperial foundation. Though my virtue is meager, I have been favored with such manifest blessings. I shall redouble my humble diligence to worthily receive this great bestowal.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Two Memorials of Thanksgiving for Rain**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that I have inherited this blessed foundation and now govern all within the four seas. Relying on Heaven’s protection, I seek to preserve the people’s harmony. Recently, as I performed the sacrificial rites, the rains were delayed, and I feared the crops would suffer, jeopardizing the harvest’s abundance. I hoped to witness the auspicious signs of the sun and moon, that the people’s desire for full granaries might be fulfilled. Thus, I offered secret prayers, and the response was swift and clear. The fields have now received their nourishing moisture. Heaven’s regard has answered like an echo, and my heart, ever vigilant, shall redouble its resolve.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

**To the Jade Emperor,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I have inherited this vast domain and secured its peace. In gratitude for Heaven’s regard, I have never forgotten my duties, waking or sleeping. Recently, as the grand rites were completed, the rains were delayed. The abundant harvests, once filling the granaries, have suffered from the lack of moisture. I prayed for the clouds to gather and the rains to nourish the land. My secret prayers were devoutly offered, and the response was swift and clear: sweet rains have now spread across the great fields. Heaven’s protective regard has been manifest, and my reverent devotion shall grow ever more earnest.

Your subject, moved beyond measure by this boundless grace, respectfully presents this memorial in gratitude. With utmost reverence and awe, I prostrate myself, bow twice, and humbly submit these words.

---

#### **Two Memorials of Thanksgiving for the Bestowal of Favor upon the Imperial Son**

**To the Three Pure Ones,**

The heir to the Heavenly Throne, your subject [Name], with utmost reverence and awe, prostrates himself and bows twice to submit this memorial.

I reflect that the vast and sheltering power of Heaven has bestowed its great protection; the flourishing of the imperial lineage has secured the eternal foundation. [Name of the imperial son], having received Heaven’s blessings, has now reached the age to begin his studies. In accordance with state rituals, he has been granted a fiefdom. Thus, I have humbly submitted to the favor of the sacred turf and further elevated his rank among the imperial guards. This great felicity adorns the imperial house, and I shall strive to repay it with earnest devotion. May his blessings ever flourish and his auspicious signs multiply.

The jade tally of Mount Qiao was already bestowed through the river’s reeds, and the burial of silk in the propitious earth was once more witnessed in the cauldron of Fen. Gazing upon the famed mountains of recorded titles, and beholding the sacred halls where spirits gather, I have conducted solemn purifications and offered pure libations to repay the vast blessings. Overwhelmed by the burden of gratitude, I can find no respite.

I prostrate myself before the Boundless Void of the Unoriginated, whose true footsteps cannot be fathomed. All beings endowed with form are encompassed by Your great mercy. The myriad transformations accord You the highest reverence, and the hundred kings receive their mandate from You. Though this humble servant is of meager virtue, I have inherited the extended succession of the celestial reckoning. Having trodden the true Dao-wind, I have distantly relied upon the sacred shelter. In the watchful stillness of the pure night, Your divine immortals suddenly descended; in the purple hall, where the spirit was concentrated, I reverently received Your secret instructions. How dare I not devoutly follow Your radiant favor and redouble my sincerity? I shall further refine the rites of purity and reverence to express my profound gratitude.

Overwhelmed by the burden of gratitude, I can find no respite.

I prostrate myself before the One whose foundation for governing the state is to honor Heaven as supreme, and whose root for transforming the people is to exalt the Dao above all. Never forgetting the reverent devotion due, I have thus been moved to this response. Auspicious omens and prophetic dreams have manifested in accord with the appointed time. As the pure night unfolded, Your purple presence descended and lingered long. I personally proclaimed Your sacred instructions, revealing the luminous signs. To receive such vast blessings fills me with shame for my inadequate virtue. I shall diligently attend to all governance to repay Your boundless grace.

Overwhelmed by the burden of gratitude, I can find no respite.

Fire precautions were neglected, and the palace precincts suffered the spread of flames. Truly, our failure in human affairs dares not offend the numinous will. We humbly offer manifest gratitude and dare not forget self-reflection. With reverent sincerity, we earnestly pray that Your utmost devotion be perceived. With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the August Sage,

Reflecting on our humble station, we have received the precious mandate; with a heart of diligent service, we strive to respond to the great blessings. Yet speaking of the princely residence, we momentarily forgot vigilance, allowing the raging flames to spread. Witnessing the alarm, our reverent awe only deepened. How dare we forget to acknowledge our fault and offer repentance to the luminous numen? With utmost sincerity and trembling devotion, we respectfully submit this prayer.

To the Various Minor Halls,

Privately reflecting on the mandate we have received, we have abundantly attained radiant favor. Yet in our humble station, we reflect and fail to repay the great blessings.

chunks.original_text: 由不谨於维城，致延灾於烈焰。 震惊中禁，焚燎端闱。 思盛德之靡昭，积丹心之引咎。 敢伸致谢，允冀俯临。 名无任恳倒之至，谨词。 三清上清宫 臣眇冲之德，靡足感通。 穹吴之仁，诞回眷顾。 莫洽建中之治，遽生炎上之祥。 维城偶失於慎微，烈焰欻惊於延燎。 载惟菲薄，敢怠责躬。 祇述诚明，庶伸昭谢。 臣无任恳倒之至，谨词。 玉皇 臣顾以眇躬，绍兹丕历。 虽靡忘於兢业，盖偶爽於堤防。 藩邸之中，遽因遗烬。 端闱之内，遂致延烧。 思有失於慎微，实自深於克己。 恭伸昭谢，允鉴至诚。 臣无任恳倒之至，谨词。 圣祖天尊大帝 臣缵绍庆图，祗畏灵命。 虽怀战栗，靡报鉴观。 烈焰延灾，偶兴於王邸； 环廊莫救，遽及於端门。 内省眇冲，靡遑宁处。 庶鸿源而昭谢，敢精意而洞伸。 臣无任恳倒之至，谨词。 宋真宗御制玉京集卷之六竟

Through negligence in guarding the princely residence, disaster spread in raging flames. The inner sanctum was shaken, the central halls consumed by fire. Reflecting on the unmanifested vastness of your virtue, we accumulate this crimson heart in self-reproach. With daring humility, we offer our gratitude, earnestly hoping for your gracious regard.

To the Three Clarities of the Supreme Clarity Palace,

This humble servant’s virtue is too meager to evoke resonance. Yet the boundless benevolence of the celestial vault has deigned to turn its compassionate gaze. Before the governance of the Central Establishment could be fully realized, the omen of ascending flames arose. A moment’s lapse in vigilance over the princely residence allowed the raging flames to suddenly spread in alarming conflagration. Mindful of our inadequacy, how dare we neglect self-examination? With reverent sincerity, we strive to express our luminous gratitude.

To the Jade Emperor,

This humble servant, inheriting this great mandate, though never forgetting diligence and caution, momentarily faltered in vigilance. Within the princely residence, a lingering ember suddenly flared. Within the central halls, the fire swiftly spread. Recognizing our failure in careful watchfulness, we deeply reproach ourselves. With reverent humility, we offer our gratitude, trusting in your gracious regard of our utmost sincerity.

To the Sacred Ancestor, Heavenly Honored Great Emperor,

This humble servant, continuing the blessed legacy, trembles in awe of the numinous mandate. Though filled with trepidation, we have failed to repay your watchful gaze. Raging flames spread disaster, arising unexpectedly in the royal residence; the encircling corridors could not be saved, and the fire swiftly reached the central gate. Inwardly reflecting on our inadequacy, we find no peace. We humbly beseech the vast source to accept our luminous gratitude, daring to extend our sincere devotion in full.

Thus concludes the sixth scroll of *The Jade Capital Collection* composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song.
